H0.text: The digestive system is responsible for breaking down food to provide cellular energy, because cells need nutrients for energy.

H1.text: Excretory is the system responsible for breaking down food to provide cellular energy for cells that need nutrients.

H2.text: Circulatory is the system responsible for breaking down food to provide cellular energy for cells that need nutrients.

H3.text: Respiratory is the system responsible for breaking down food to provide cellular energy for cells that need nutrients.

A4.text: Digestion involves the breakdown of food into smaller and smaller components, until they can be absorbed and assimilated into the body.

A5.text: The chylomicrons are small enough to pass through the enterocyte villi and into their lymph capillaries called lacteals.
